instructions.name: initialize
docs: Initialize the gumball machine account with the specified data.
0. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be pre-allocated but zero content)

accounts.name: gumballMachine
docs: Gumball Machine account. The account space must be allocated to allow accounts larger

accounts.name: authority
docs: Gumball Machine authority. This is the address that controls the upate of the gumball machine.

accounts.name: authority
docs: Gumball Machine authority. This is the address that controls the upate of the gumball machine.

instructions.name: addNft
docs: Add legacy NFTs to the gumball machine.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])

instructions.name: addCoreAsset
docs: Add Core assets to the gumball machine.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])

accounts.name: collection
docs: Core asset's collection if it's part of one.

instructions.name: addTokens
docs: Add fungible tokens to the gumball machine.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])

instructions.name: requestAddNft
docs: Request to add a NFT to the gumball machine.
Freezes the seller's NFT and creates a request account.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller]).
2. `[writable]` Add item request account (PDA, seeds: ["add_item_request", mint]).
6. `[writable]` Seller's token account for the NFT.

instructions.name: requestAddCoreAsset
docs: Request to add a core asset to the gumball machine.
Freezes the seller's asset and creates a request account.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller]).
2. `[writable]` Add item request account (PDA, seeds: ["add_item_request", asset]).
6. `[writable, optional]` Collection account if asset is part of one.

accounts.name: collection
docs: Core asset's collection if it's part of one.

instructions.name: cancelAddNftRequest
docs: Cancel a request to add a NFT to the gumball machine.
Thaws and revokes delegate from the seller's NFT and closes the request account.
0. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", add_item_request.gumball_machine, seller]).
1. `[writable]` Add item request account (PDA, seeds: ["add_item_request", mint]). Will be closed.
5. `[writable]` Seller's token account for the NFT.

accounts.name: metadata
docs: /// CHECK: Safe due to token metadata program check

instructions.name: cancelAddCoreAssetRequest
docs: Cancel a request to add a core asset to the gumball machine.
Thaws and revokes delegate from the seller's asset and closes the request account.
0. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", add_item_request.gumball_machine, seller]).
1. `[writable]` Add item request account (PDA, seeds: ["add_item_request", asset]). Will be closed.
5. `[writable, optional]` Collection account if asset is part of one.

accounts.name: collection
docs: Core asset's collection if it's part of one.

instructions.name: approveAddItem
docs: Approve adding an item to the gumball machine.
Moves the item from the request to the gumball machine's config lines.
1. `[writable]` Add item request account (PDA, seeds: ["add_item_request", asset]). Will be closed.
3. `[signer, writable]` Authority of the gumball machine.
4. `[writable]` Seller account (receiver of closed request account rent).

instructions.name: removeNft
docs: Remove legacy NFT from the gumball machine.
Thaws and revokes delegate from the seller's NFT and removes it from the config lines.
The signer can be the Gumball Machine authority or the seller of the specific item.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller]).
3. `[signer]` Authority allowed to remove (gumball machine authority or item seller).
6. `[writable]` Seller's token account for the NFT.

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority allowed to remove the nft (must be the gumball machine auth or the seller of the nft)

accounts.name: metadata
docs: /// CHECK: Safe due to token metadata program check

instructions.name: removeCoreAsset
docs: Remove Core asset from the gumball machine.
Thaws and revokes delegate from the seller's asset and removes it from the config lines.
The signer can be the Gumball Machine authority or the seller of the specific item.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller]).
3. `[signer]` Authority allowed to remove (gumball machine authority or item seller).
6. `[writable, optional]` Collection account if asset is part of one.

accounts.name: collection
docs: Core asset's collection if it's part of one.

instructions.name: removeTokens
docs: Remove fungible tokens from the gumball machine.
The signer can be the Gumball Machine authority or the seller of the specific item.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])
3. `[signer, writable]` Authority allowed to remove (gumball machine authority or item seller).

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority allowed to remove the nft (must be the gumball machine auth or the seller of the nft)

instructions.name: removeTokensSpan
docs: Remove fungible tokens from the gumball machine.
The signer can be the Gumball Machine authority or the seller of the specific item.
1. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])
3. `[signer, writable]` Authority allowed to remove (gumball machine authority or item seller).

accounts.name: authority
docs: Authority allowed to remove the nft (must be the gumball machine auth or the seller of the nft)

accounts.name: authority
docs: Gumball Machine authority. This can be the mint authority or the authority.

instructions.name: endSale
docs: Disables minting and allows sales to be settled.

accounts.name: authority
docs: Gumball Machine authority. This is the address that controls the upate of the gumball machine.

instructions.name: draw
docs: Draw for a random item from the gumball machine.
Only the gumball machine mint authority is allowed to draw.

accounts.name: mintAuthority
docs: Gumball machine mint authority (mint only allowed for the mint_authority).

accounts.name: payer
docs: Payer for the transaction and account allocation (rent).

instructions.name: incrementTotalRevenue
docs: Increments total revenue earned by the gumball machine.
Only the gumball machine mint authority is allowed to increment revenue. This is
required as token transfers don't occur in this program, but total is needed

accounts.name: mintAuthority
docs: Gumball machine mint authority (mint only allowed for the mint_authority).

instructions.name: sellItem
docs: Sell an item back to the gumball machine using buy back funds.
The payer must be the seller or the oracle_signer.
Buying back to the gumball machine is currently not supported, but will be in the future.
If buying back to the authority, the item is marked as claimed and transferred to the buyer (authority).
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (must be seller or oracle_signer)
4. `[writable]` Mint account of the item (or Asset account for Core)
6. `[writable]` Buyer account (must be gumball machine or authority)
12. `[writable, optional]` Fee payment account (if fee configured)
13. `[writable, optional]` Payment mint (if not native SOL)
14. `[writable, optional]` Seller payment account (if not native SOL)
15. `[writable, optional]` Authority PDA payment account (if not native SOL)
18. `[writable, optional]` Authority PDA token account (for NFT/Fungible)
24. `[writable, optional]` Authority PDA token record (for pNFT)

accounts.name: payer
docs: Must be the oracle signer or seller (oracle signer can sell on behalf of the seller to allow auto-buy back)

accounts.name: mint
docs: Mint of the item (or asset for Core assets)

accounts.name: feeAccount
docs: OPTIONAL FEE ACCOUNTS - only required if there is a fee config on the gumball machine

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: OPTIONAL SPL TOKEN ACCOUNTS - only required if selling for SPL token

accounts.name: collection
docs: OPTIONAL CORE ASSET ACCOUNTS - only required if selling Core asset

accounts.name: authorityPdaTokenAccount
docs: OPTIONAL TOKEN ACCOUNTS - only required if selling NFT or Fungible assets

accounts.name: metadata
docs: OPTIONAL NFT ACCOUNTS - only required if selling NFT or PNFT

accounts.name: authorityPdaTokenRecord
docs: OPTIONAL PNFT ACCOUNTS - only required if selling PNFT

instructions.name: claimCoreAsset
docs: Claims a Core asset from the gumball machine for a specific buyer.
Transfers the asset from the PDA to the buyer.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can claim the item)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleLive or SaleEnded state)
7. `[writable, optional]` Collection account if asset is part of one.

instructions.name: claimNft
docs: Claims a legacy NFT from the gumball machine for a specific buyer.
Thaws and transfers the NFT from the PDA to the buyer.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can claim the item)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleLive or SaleEnded state)

instructions.name: claimTokens
docs: Claims fungible tokens from the gumball machine for a specific buyer.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can claim the tokens)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleLive or SaleEnded state)
11. `[writable]` Buyer's token account (must match mint and buyer)
12. `[writable]` Authority PDA's token account (must match mint and authority PDA)

instructions.name: settleCoreAssetSale
docs: If the item hasn't been claimed yet, it claims it for the seller (or buyer if specified).
Distributes proceeds according to royalties and fee configuration.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can settle the sale)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleEnded state)
8. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])
18. `[writable, optional]` Collection account if asset is part of one.

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

accounts.name: authorityPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority if using token payment

accounts.name: sellerPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for seller if using token payment

accounts.name: feeAccount
docs: Fee account for marketplace fee if using fee config

accounts.name: feePaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for marketplace fee if using token payment

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: Payment mint if using non-native payment token

instructions.name: settleNftSale
docs: If the item hasn't been claimed yet, it claims it for the seller (or buyer if specified).
Distributes proceeds according to royalties and fee configuration. Marks primary sale happened if applicable.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can settle the sale)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleEnded state)
8. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

accounts.name: authorityPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority if using token payment

accounts.name: sellerPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for seller if using token payment

accounts.name: feeAccount
docs: Fee account for marketplace fee if using fee config

accounts.name: feePaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for marketplace fee if using token payment

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: Payment mint if using non-native payment token

instructions.name: settleTokensSale
docs: If the item hasn't been claimed yet, it claims it for the seller (or buyer if specified).
Distributes proceeds according to fee configuration.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can settle the sale)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleEnded state)
8. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])
18. `[writable]` Receiver's token account (buyer or seller if buyer is default)

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

accounts.name: authorityPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority if using token payment

accounts.name: sellerPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for seller if using token payment

accounts.name: feeAccount
docs: Fee account for marketplace fee if using fee config

accounts.name: feePaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for marketplace fee if using token payment

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: Payment mint if using non-native payment token

instructions.name: settleTokensSaleClaimed
docs: Settles a fungible tokens sale that has already been claimed by the buyer or does not have a buyer.
This can settle multiple items in a single transaction via the `start_index` and `end_index` args.
Distributes proceeds according to fee configuration and sends unsold tokens back to the seller.
0. `[signer, writable]` Payer (anyone can settle the sale)
1. `[writable]` Gumball Machine account (must be in SaleEnded state)
8. `[writable]` Seller history account (PDA, seeds: ["seller_history", gumball_machine, seller])
15. `[writable]` Seller's token account (for receiving unsold tokens)

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

accounts.name: authorityPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority if using token payment

accounts.name: sellerPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for seller if using token payment

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: Payment mint if using non-native payment token

instructions.name: setAuthority
docs: Set a new authority of the gumball machine.

instructions.name: setMintAuthority
docs: Set a new mint authority of the gumball machine.

instructions.name: withdraw
docs: Withdraw the rent lamports and send them to the authority address.
If a non-native payment mint was used, also closes the PDA payment token account,
sending its balance to the authority's associated token account.
Remaining accounts (if closing non-native payment account):
- `[writable]` Authority's token account for payment mint

accounts.name: mintAuthority
docs: Mint authority of the gumball machine.

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

instructions.name: manageBuyBackFunds
docs: Manage the buy back funds of the gumball machine.

accounts.name: authorityPaymentAccount
docs: Authority's token account if using token payment

accounts.name: authorityPdaPaymentAccount
docs: Payment account for authority pda if using token payment

accounts.name: paymentMint
docs: Payment mint if using non-native payment token

accounts.name: GumballMachine
docs: Gumball machine state and config data.

fields.name: mintAuthority
docs: Authority address allowed to mint from the gumball machine.

fields.name: marketplaceFeeConfig
docs: Fee config for the marketplace this gumball is listed on

fields.name: itemsSettled
docs: Number of assets settled after sale.

fields.name: totalRevenue
docs: Amount of lamports/tokens received from purchases.

fields.name: state
docs: True if the authority has finalized details, which prevents adding more nfts.

accounts.name: SellerHistory
docs: Seller history state to track count of items submitted to a gumball machine.

fields.name: itemCount
docs: Item count submitted by this seller

fields.name: enabled
docs: Whether buying back prizes is enabled

fields.name: toGumballMachine
docs: Whether buying back prizes should be added back to the gumball machine (not yet supported)

fields.name: oracleSigner
docs: Authority that must sign when buying back prizes, to ensure pricing is correct

fields.name: valuePct
docs: Percentage of prize value the creator/gumball machine will pay for buying back prizes

fields.name: marketplaceFeeBps
docs: Fee in basis points paid to marketplace authority when buying back prizes (paid from funds_available)

fields.name: cutoffPct
docs: Buy backs are disabled when the percentage of items remaining is less than or equal to this value
0 means there is no cutoff, 100 means buy back is always disabled, 50 means buy back is disabled when 50% of items are sold
If an item is sold back to the gumball machine to increase the remaining % above this cutoff, buy back is re-enabled

types.name: ConfigLineInput
docs: Config line struct for storing asset (NFT) data pre-mint.

fields.name: seller
docs: Wallet that submitted the asset for sale.

types.name: ConfigLineV2Input
docs: Config line struct for storing asset (NFT) data pre-mint.

fields.name: seller
docs: Wallet that submitted the asset for sale.

types.name: ConfigLine
docs: Config line struct for storing asset data.

fields.name: seller
docs: Wallet that submitted the asset for sale.

fields.name: buyer
docs: Wallet that will receive the asset upon sale. Empty until drawn.

types.name: ConfigLineV2
docs: Config line struct for storing asset data.

fields.name: seller
docs: Wallet that submitted the asset for sale.

fields.name: buyer
docs: Wallet that will receive the asset upon sale. Empty until drawn.

fields.name: uri
docs: Uri of off-chain metadata, max length 196

fields.name: itemCapacity
docs: Number of assets that can be added.

fields.name: itemsPerSeller
docs: Max number of items that can be added by a single seller.

fields.name: sellersMerkleRoot
docs: Merkle root hash for sellers who can add items to the machine.

fields.name: curatorFeeBps
docs: Fee basis points paid to the machine authority.

fields.name: hideSoldItems
docs: True if the front end should hide items that have been sold.

errors.name: IncorrectOwner
errors.msg: Account does not have correct owner

errors.name: TooManyCreators
errors.msg: Can only provide up to 4 creators to gumball machine (because gumball machine is one)

errors.name: HiddenSettingsDoNotHaveConfigLines
errors.msg: Gumball machines using hidden uris do not have config lines, they have a single hash representing hashed order

errors.name: CannotChangeNumberOfLines
errors.msg: Cannot change number of lines unless is a hidden config

errors.name: CannotSwitchToHiddenSettings
errors.msg: Cannot switch to hidden settings after items available is greater than 0

errors.name: MetadataAccountMustBeEmpty
errors.msg: The metadata account has data in it, and this must be empty to mint a new NFT

errors.name: NoChangingCollectionDuringMint
errors.msg: Can't change collection settings after items have begun to be minted

errors.name: ExceededLengthError
errors.msg: Value longer than expected maximum value

errors.name: CannotIncreaseLength
errors.msg: Cannot increase the length in config lines settings

errors.name: CannotChangeSequentialIndexGeneration
errors.msg: Cannot change sequential index generation after items have begun to be minted

errors.name: CouldNotRetrieveConfigLineData
errors.msg: Could not retrive config line data

errors.name: NotFullyLoaded
errors.msg: Not all config lines were added to the gumball machine

errors.name: NotAllSettled
errors.msg: Not all items have been settled
